channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16266] Do not throw ScannerTimeoutException when catch UnknownScannerException
item.description: Now in scanner we have heartbeat to prevent timeout. The time blocked on ResultScanner.next() may much longer than scanner timeout. So it is no need any more to throw ScannerTimeoutException when server throws UnknownScannerException, we can just reset the scanner like NotServingRegionException
item.summary: Do not throw ScannerTimeoutException when catch UnknownScannerException

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message was automatically generated.

Patch looks nice Phil Yang

What is an example scenario that makes the below?

The time blocked on ResultScanner.next() may much longer than scanner timeout.

Thanks (could put it in release note – this look likes a nice fix)

Thanks for reviewing.

What is an example scenario that makes the below?

At server if the scanner reaches size limit or time limit, partial result or heartbeat will be responded to the client, then the client will send a new rpc call until the client get at least a whole row and can return a Result to user. So the total time of blocking on ResultScanner.next() depends on how many rpc requests in loadCache() and may be longer than a single rpc timeout

Let's commit and resolve this issue? stack

Thanks.

This is not a big change so let's finish it. Will commit if no objections till this evening.

Thanks.
Pushed to branch-1.1+. Thanks Phil Yang for the patch. Thanks all for reviewing.
Thanks Duo Zhang (and thanks for the considered fix Phil Yang)
